data.title: Lots to see and learn about.
data.text:
We stopped by the Toledo Museum of Art in the afternoon. We visited the children's activity and worked with clay. The volunteers attended to the children and helped them work with the clay and tools.
The museum staff was clearly leery of the children. They appeared to be on "high alert" closely following us and our children. Nothing was touched or broken, thank heavens. They kids acted like they had been to a museum before. I do not fault the staff. Better to be overly cautious then under secured.

data.title: One of the nation's great Art Museums
data.text: I have been going to the Toledo Museum of Art since I was 5 years old. By this time that's almost a half-century. As a young violinist I performed many times at the peristyle. It remains one of the most beautiful concert halls in the nation. This Museum is host to some of the greatest works of art of all varieties and time periods. Additionally it has programs for young people and hosts the Toledo Youth Orchestra for their annual concerts, and organization that I was proud to be the concertmaster of in the 1980s. I highly recommend if you have not been to the museum that you should go and enjoy it.

data.title: Toledo Museum of Art, a treasure
data.text:
The Toledo Museum of Art is not huge, but I think that is a plus.  The Museum holds fine exhibits of a variety of art, artists and art periods.  The Glass Museum that is just across the street--easy to get to--is excellent and we enjoyed watching a demonstration of glass blowing.  The demonstrators were more than willing to answer questions as they went along with their work as well as commenting on a particular step in the process of developing the piece.  We have been to the Art Museum about three times because they often have special exhibits that are more than worthwhile driving slightly over an hour to see.  

One added plus: the restaurant actually serves good food!

data.title: Toledo's Gem
data.text: The Toledo Museum of Art is not to be missed.  It is one of the nation's top museum.  It offers an impressive collection of Classical Art.  If you like Contemporary Art, the museum seems to be expanding its collection and concentrating more resources in this area.

data.title: Nice museum
data.text: It is a very nice museum. It's nice to wander through and check out the new exhibits. They always seem to have something fun passing through.

data.title: Amazing Libby Doll Collection
data.text: Just a wonderful collection of dolls...period pieces.  Such historical details...in every one.   Thank you TAM for unearthing these gems.   I would love to have a booklet describing each doll.  My husband was very impressed also.  The quality of the exhibts are just wonderful...

data.title: Unique free museum
data.text: We went to the Toledo museum and glass museum on a Friday night when they are open late. The exhibit was on political ads which was done very well; packed with information; video, audio and visual; Another exhibit was on food and art and we took a docent led tour; that one was fun and very creatve. The glass pavilion is across the street; they have glass blowing demos and gorgeous glass. We had food in the restaurant which was good and reasonable priced. The museum is free, but parking is $7. You can find on the street parking if you are not a member.

data.title: Absolutely Outstanding
data.text: This is a treasure for the city, state and country. The finest exhibits in a variety of styles are inside. Don't miss the Glass Pavilion. Something new all the time.

data.title: Wonderful museum and Glass Pavillion
data.text: Our main goal was the Glass Pavilion and, unfortunately, they were between displays in the main galleries so I can't give a full evaluation of the Glass Pavilion, but they did have a great hot glass show and the pavilion itself is interesting.  The main museum, across the street, is as good as it gets with a full range of art in their galleries.  Parking is convenient since the museum is not in the middle of the city and that is a big plus.

data.title: Always changing..always something new to view
data.text: Toledo's gem !!!  The different exhibits offer something for everyone. I took my granddaughter to some of the activities offered for children and she had a super day, including lunch and a visit to the gift for a blown glass heart.

data.title: You won't believe this in in Toledo - OHIO!
data.text: This is one of the most incredible museums anywhere, and I have experienced the well-known museums of the world. Thanks to the Libbey family of Owens Corning fame Toledo has a world class museum.  The classically designed building with a collection that will amaze you, and now they have a newer glass museum across Monroe Ave.  It's all beyond words and if you are anywhere near Toledo you don't want to miss this located very close to downtown.  It is admirable that they charge no admission to the museum, only a $7 parking fee, which allows families and people of all incomes to enjoy these treasures.  Plan to spend at least half a day.  Enjoy!

data.title: It's always a pleasure to visit the Toledo Museum of Art
data.text: The Toledo Museum of Art is continually changing their exhibits and offers great lectures and events - often for free.  If you have just an hour or more, be sure to stop in to see what is on exhibit.  And don't forget to get a bite to eat at The Café as it always offers great food.

data.title: Great Time
data.text: Had a great time visiting this museum. There was plenty to see and learn. The museum is set up beautifully and easy to maneuver through. And it was something FREE to do while we visited Toledo. I enjoyed it so much that I will re- visit whenever I go back to Toledo.

data.title: Beautiful buildings, impressive statues
data.text: It was a great view, especially in fall when the leaves turned red or yellow. My mother and I took a walk in the garden outside where all the statues are located, and that was our favorite memories of art in Toledo!

data.title: Gem in the Midwest. Would be a highlight even if it were located in New York City.
data.text: The Toledo Museum of Art is world class. Great art  inside with an exterior that is Classic Greek. Don't miss it if you are in Toledo.

data.title: Amazing collection, both in breadth and depth
data.text: Had heard this was a surprising museum but was completely blow away by the French Impressionists they had off the main lobby.   There was also a good Korean and Asian collection although it is mostly ceramics and scrolls.  The outside sculpture was really exceptional, creative and engaging both in arrangement and variety.  Had expected a primarily glass focused collection given Toledo's history, but this really excellent museum has much more than that.

data.title: awe inspiring
data.text: This place! I can not say enough of how this place has changed me in so many ways! It has given me a new found love for glass! For Art!  My wife and I on Sunday sat for 2 and a half hours watching the glass making demo and walked through the glass museum. walked across the street and did a quick walk through of the paintings. just not enough time.  I am moved beyond words of what your city has!  It is a gem!  Never  before have I been among such ancient works of art! Thank you Toledo!

data.title: Best first date!
data.text: It is hard to describe this place! It is a jewel in the City of Toledo. We have incredible art here. I takes you back in time. It is a great first date. For one it's free and you can just look at beautiful art without feeling like you need to do much talking! The museum entertains you. If you are out town you must visit here! Also don't forget to see a Toledo Symphony concert at the Peristyle inside this museum! It is a can't miss. They also have art classes and a glass pavilion.

data.title: Good overall-- and great for glass!
data.text: Every chance I get traveling through Toledo (live in CT, so not often), I make sure to stop here (even got in a flash flood once right on the grounds!).  Very nice mid-sized museum generally, with one of the best glass collections anywhere (Corning Museum of Glass in Corning NY is best, but this is right up there).  This time watched glass blowing demonstration as well as viewing the great objects, both historical and current.

data.title: Wonderful Museum!
data.text: Absolutely wonderful museum.  The collection is varied and of high quality.  There is something for everyone here.  The staff are courteous and helpful.  Try the restaurant, they have great food with a but of an eclectic twist, a little pricey but worth it.  Also, like many of the finest museums, it is free, you just pay a small fee for parking.  If you love art museums, I'd recommend setting aside most of the day for this one.
